intro: Achyrospermum urens, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in partial shade to full sun. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other climbing and trailing plants. Its rapid growth and ornamental appeal make it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
